title: BBC Local Live: North West of England on Friday 2 March - BBC News
summary: more than 200 motorists spend the night on m62 due to snow chaos .
m62 motorway to stay closed 'into the weekend ' , bbc understands .
rochdale residents take hot drinks and food to trapped drivers .
most transpennine routes are closed to traffic .

documents.title: reading 1-1 bolton wanderers
text: reading 1-1 bolton wanderers

documents.title: crystal palace 2-3 manchester united
text: crystal palace 2-3 manchester united
author: Tom Rostance
BBC Sport

documents.title: rail services resume after defect repair
text: rail services resume after defect repair

documents.title: preston bus lane cameras 'about cutting congestion ' , says councillor
text: reacting to the news that 100 motorists are still being fined for straying into preston town centre 's bus lanes , county councillor keith iddon , cabinet member for highways and transport , said : `` we have put out a lot of information to make people aware of the bus lanes .
we also increased both the permanent and temporary signing before we brought back enforcement last year .
`` there are many signs around the city centre and on various approaches to the city , which make people aware of the bus lanes .
`` the aim of these bus lanes is to reduce congestion which has affected the city centre at certain times .
we 're happy if we do n't make a penny from the cameras , as it means that people are doing the right thing .

`` i am encouraged to note that the numbers are down by over 40 % for december and january compared to last year , which shows that the message is getting across to many drivers and i hope that this trend continues . ''

documents.title: oldham man in court over shop explosion that killed five
text: an oldham man has appeared in court charged over a shop explosion in leicester which killed five people .
the polish supermarket and a flat above it were destroyed in the explosion on the evening of 25 february .
arkan ali , 37 , of drake close , oldham , is charged with manslaughter and arson along with the store 's owner aram kurd , 33 , and hawkar hassan , 32 .
the defendants were remanded in custody by leicester magistrates and will appear at leicester crown court via video link on 3 april .

documents.title: tributes to student found dead in canal
text: tributes to student found dead in canal

documents.title: inspector 'strangled wife over debts '
text: inspector 'strangled wife over debts '

documents.title: bailiffs sent to blackpool football club
text: former blackpool football club director valeri belokon has begun legal enforcement against the club 's owner owen oyston by sending bailiffs to its bloomfield road stadium .
author: Blackpool Gazette

documents.title: rugby league : saints trounce salford
text: rugby league super league leaders st helens made short work of salford as they ran in six tries to make it four wins out of four , with the match finishing 34 points to 2 on sunday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: blackpool fc : belokon sends out bailiffs to recoup oyston cash
text: lawyers acting for former blackpool director valeri belokon have sent bailiffs to retrieve assets from the club 's owners , the oyston family , bbc radio lancashire reports .
the oystons were ordered to buy out mr belokon 's company vb football assets after a civil trial in november 2017 .
however , a deadline to pay a £ 10m instalment was missed in february .
`` mr belokon continues to have the interests of the club at heart , '' law firm clifford chance said .
the oyston family still have to pay at least £ 20m of the £ 31m owed to latvian businessman belokon following november 's judgement .
an initial payment of £ 10m was made within 28 days of the case ending , with a second similar sum due last month .

`` we can confirm that our client is continuing to take steps to enforce the payment of the judgment debt that is owed to it by owen oyston , karl oyston and blackpool football ( properties ) limited , '' the statement continued .
`` mr belokon emphasises that the actions being taken by bailiffs in blackpool are not directed at blackpool football club limited or the football related assets . ''

documents.title: muddy lessons at outdoor pre-school
text: muddy lessons at outdoor pre-school

documents.title: blackpool owners chased for non-payment
text: blackpool owners chased for non-payment

documents.title: inspector 'strangled detective wife and dumped body in lake '
text: a police inspector strangled his detective wife before dumping her body in a lake , a court has heard .
darren mckie , 43 , denies murdering his wife leanne mckie , 39 , a detective constable , whose body was found in poynton lake in cheshire in september last year .
opening the trial at chester crown court , nigel power qc , prosecuting , showed the jury dashcam footage from a police car of mr mckie walking in wilmslow at 01.31 and 02.10 on 29 september .
at 03.45 that day mrs mckie 's body was discovered at the lake .
mr power said : `` she was in shallow water , but she had n't drowned .
she had been strangled to death . ''
he said friends had described the couple , who had three children , as the `` perfect family '' , but there were money problems .

documents.title: bus lane road sees more then 100 motorists a day fined
text: more than 100 motorists a day are being fined for straying into preston 's town centre bus lanes .
drivers who ignore the signs on fishergate face a £ 60 fine .
the scheme has netted lancashire county council more than £ 400,000 since december .
when the cameras were first brought in , thousands of drivers had to be refunded after an adjudicator ruled the signs were inadequate .

documents.title: teenagers held over liverpool stab attack
text: two 15-year-old boys have been arrested on sus of attempted murder over the stabbing of a 38-year-old man in liverpool last month .
merseyside police said the boys , from dovecot and huyton , were released on bail pending further inquiries .
the man was stabbed in the back man as he walked along aldwark road , dovecot , after being approached by a group .
a police spokesman said the victim remains in a stable condition in hospital , where he has received treatment to a number of stab wounds and a jaw injury .

documents.title: candle tribute planned for liverpool murder victim
text: family and friends of yusuf sonko will light candles in his memory later in liverpool on what would have been his 19th birthday - almost a year after he was shot and killed in the city .
yusuf was shot in the head on a toxteth street in june last year .
no one has been charged with his murder , despite repeated appeals for information from his family .
they have appealed for an end to the `` no grass '' culture they believe has prevented the teenager 's killers being caught .

documents.title: more than 35 firefighters tackled tarleton blaze
text: more than 35 firefighters battled a serious blaze in a joiner 's workshop in tarleton , fire services have said .
author: Lancashire Post

documents.title: how bingo is being changed forever
text: how bingo is being changed forever

documents.title: prehistoric fossil sheds light on early birdlife
text: a tiny fossil of a prehistoric baby bird is helping scientists at the university of manchester understand how early forms of birdlife came into existence in the age of the dinosaurs .
the nearly complete skeleton is of a chick from a group of prehistoric birds called enantiornithes , dating back about 250 million years .
the university said the 5cm long bird is one of the smallest known avian fossils discovered and could offer an invaluable insight into the lives of early birdlife .

the lead author of the study , dr fabien knoll , from the university of manchester 's interdisciplinary centre for ancient life said by analysing the fossil 's bone development it `` can look at a whole host of evolutionary traits '' .

documents.title: mayor demands metrolink is 'held to account ' over tram delays
text: greater manchester 's mayor andy burnham has called for `` more accountability '' from the region 's metrolink tram system - following repeated severe delays in recent weeks .
a report into issues with the service on 19 february will be published later today , after the mayor demanded urgent talks with the system 's operators .
mr burnham said the report will show there were `` communications failures at the very least '' , and the way metrolink recovered from recent technical problems `` was n't good enough '' .
he called for more `` accountability to the travelling public '' and said he would introduce a monthly `` performance report '' for the system .
`` the incident we had a couple of weeks ago , it was a problem with the overhead lines , it damaged every tram that went through , '' he said .
`` those things sadly can happen on any transport system .
the question is how do you recover from them and that was n't good enough .
`` that 's why i 'm saying i want stronger arrangements in place so the public can hold the system to account .
and it 's not just late-running services , it 's cancellations as well .
we need all that data in the public domain .
`` i 'm introducing a new regime for metrolink .
it 's the right thing to do . ''
you can listen to the mayor speaking on bbc radio manchester on iplayer

documents.title: oscars : from hollyoaks to hollywood
text: oscars : from hollyoaks to hollywood

documents.title: boy , 17 , guilty of claw hammer murder
text: a teenager who bragged about `` being a psychopath '' has been found guilty of murdering a man with a claw hammer .
richard percival , known as dickie , was found dead at his home in newton-le-willows , merseyside , on 18 august .
the 17-year-old , who can not be named for legal reasons , claimed he attacked the 71-year-old because he had made sexual advances towards him .
the teenager , who also stole cash from the victim , was convicted of murder at liverpool crown court on friday .

documents.title: flood warning in place for wyre estuary
text: a flood warning has been issued to coincide with the high tide on the wyre estuary in lancashire at 13:30 .
the environment agency said : `` tidal spray and onshore flooding may occur on roads and promenades , while some properties along the coast may be affected . ''
agency staff have checked flood defences and will continue to monitor sea levels and weather conditions .

documents.title: warrington wolves : four fans hit with banning orders
text: warrington wolves have issued banning orders to four fans after incidents during their 18-10 super league win at widnes vikings .
smoke bombs were set off in the away end concourse at half-time in the game on 16 february , and a flare was also thrown onto the pitch .
`` the club , and the sport of rugby league , will not tolerate the behaviour displayed , '' a club statement said .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: radio dj makes guest appearance on drums with rappers
text: broadcaster jeremy vine surprised a teenage audience when he made a guest appearance as drummer for manchester rap outfit y.o.u.n.g in london .

the radio two stalwart was invited to perform with the band after asking them to appear on his show last year , and because of his teenage experience drumming in a series of punk bands with his brother , the comedian tim vine .

with names such as wait and see , the sharp suits , two can talk and the flared generation , they never made it musically , although the flared generation once got a review in smash hits magazine but only as the most unfashionable punk band in the country . ''
y.o.u.n.g frontman chez davis said : we could n't believe it when jeremy said he was going to perform with us .
it was an epic night and one that will live long in the memory . ''

documents.title: jailed £ 1m scam boss back with the nhs
text: an nhs manager who was locked up for a £ 1m con went back to work for the health service after being freed .
author: Manchester Evening News

documents.title: wire issue banning orders to four fans
text: wire issue banning orders to four fans

documents.title: hunt for region 's forgotten memorials
text: a call for people in the north west to reveal the region 's more obscure memorials has been made by historic england .

the public body responsible for championing and looking after england 's historic environment wants photographs and information about the north west 's lesser-known memorials , especially those that are well-loved by small groups or communities .

historic england said among the lesser known memorials in the region is the abraham lincoln statue in manchester recalling how workers boycotted cotton from the southern states of the usa in the american civil war .

it also cites the heroes of the engine room memorial on liverpool 's waterfront which honours the 244 engineers who lost their lives in the titanic disaster as they remained in the ship to supply the ship with electricity and other amenities for as long as possible .

text: boy , 17 , guilty of claw hammer murder

documents.title: 'dangerous ' icicles removed from railway bridge
text: you can tell it was cold last week - i 've just seen a job in from an officer last thursday reporting dangerous 4ft long icicles dangling from a railway bridge in ancoats !
@ twitterid attended to deal - i have a vision of them on a step ladder with a hairdryer .
insp m
i had 4 foot icicles dangling from my bloody nose last week tbf .
did they have an icy cull ?
well done to officer for seeing , assessing and reporting !
# notallaboutcrime
air rifle would sort them out .
love it ! !
what , no photo ?
partner agencies working alongside each other , tough few days .
cheers

documents.title: airbus warns of brexit parts supply risk
text: airbus warns of brexit parts supply risk

documents.title: family of hit-and-run death gran want more done to tackle off-road bikes
text: relatives of a great-grandmother who was killed by a teenager on a scrambler say `` something must change '' .
may laidlaw , 78 , was hit as she crossed a road in liverpool in december .
a 14-year-old boy was detained after admitting causing death by dangerous driving and failing to stop .
mrs laidlaw 's family said they want police to have more powers to tackle people who use illegal scrambler bikes .
a police chief said he believed some bikes were 'like a weapon ' .
this story will be explored in detail on bbc inside out north west at 19:30 on bbc one , or via iplayer for 30 days afterwards .

documents.title: criticism 'wo n't shake ' oxlade-chamberlain
text: criticism 'wo n't shake ' oxlade-chamberlain

documents.title: man treated for shotgun wounds after attack in whiston
text: a man in his 30s suffered gunshot wounds in an attack in merseyside on sunday evening , police have said .
armed police were called to lyneham , whiston at around 20:30 gmt after reports of a shooting .
shortly afterwards a man in his 30s attended hospital with wounds to his back and legs , believed to have been caused by a shotgun .
his wounds were not life-threatening , said merseyside police .
det insp matt smith said : `` to fire any weapon in the street at any time is incredibly reckless and we will act on all information from the community to establish what has happened . ''

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from the live team for now , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with more of the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across the region .
in the meantime , this page will be updated automatically with content from across the bbc .
have a great weekend , and stay safe in the wintry weather .

documents.title: weather : temperatures to plunge for another chilly night
text: you wo n't be surprised to hear another freezing night is in store across the region , with lows of about -2c .
it will be cloudy at times with ice and some snow flurries developing , with moderate easterly winds .
more from bbc weather .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: m62 to remain closed as 90mph winds continue
text: a stretch of the m62 between greater manchester and west yorkshire is likely to remain closed into this evening due to wind speeds of up to 90mph , highways england have said .
snow , ice and high winds have left the motorway shut in both directions between junctions 20 and 24 .
the snow has now been cleared and gritters are spreading salt to keep it free from ice so the motorway can reopen safely once wind speeds drop to below 60mph , the agency said .

documents.title: report on liverpool city council 's everton deal kept secret
text: a liverpool council report on the risks of funding everton 's new stadium is to be kept secret .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: latest headlines from the north west
text: latest headlines from the north west

documents.title: the secret of tram sunday ? no trams
text: the secret of tram sunday ? no trams

documents.title: firefighters find source of strand shopping centre fire
text: firefighters have found the source of a fire at the new strand shopping centre in bootle .
a merseyside fire service spokesman said firefighters had drilled through concrete to get to the fire `` which is in a void where rubbish is collected '' .
two engines were called to the scene around 12:40 gmt with when smoke was discovered causing the centre to be evacuated .

documents.title: more than 300 people taken to m62 rescue centres
text: greater manchester police have revealed that more than 300 people were taken to rescue centres in rochdale and milnrow .
this included people taken to newhey primary school near milnrow where people were provided with hot drinks , food and blankets .

documents.title: fire at bus depot
text: firefighters tackled a blaze at a bus depot in warrington for several hours after it broke out just after 01:00 gmt .
author: Warrington Guardian

documents.title: homeless man dies after leaving preston shelter
text: a homeless man died in -10c temperatures after leaving a shelter in preston and then collapsing .
author: Lancashire Post

documents.title: storm emma : '80mph winds closed m62 ' , say police
text: winds of up to 80mph caused the m62 to be closed between rochdale and huddersfield , police have said .
asst ch con rob potts of greater manchester police revealed that the high winds were a key factor as well as the snow .
highways england 's chris chadwick said : `` wind speeds of up to 80mph caused the problems for us on the motorway .
`` our threshold is 60mph - at that point we look at closure . ''
police also revealed that 200 cars stranded overnight have now been moved leaving just 25 hgv lorries still on the carriageway .

documents.title: work to restore power to homes delayed by high winds and snow
text: power has been restored to around 7,500 homes but high winds and drifting snow are causing problems for engineers after scores of lines were brought down overnight .
but electricity north west said there are still 5,000 properties without power across 100 separate faults on the network .
a spokesman said high winds caused the initial damage with the weight of snow and ice causing lines to come down and poles to break .
`` our engineers are working in increasingly difficult conditions .
high winds and drifting snow are making it difficult for them to get to site and restore power supplies . ''
# stormemma postcode update -matt
bb2 definitely still effected , my mum and dad are without power , was showing as estimated repair time of 3pm but still no electric
hi anna , apologies for the delay in responding .
please could you confirm the full address & postcode to allow me to look into this for you if the power is still off ?
- hannah
thanks hannah , i 've dm 'd
hi anna , thanks i 've seen your dm the timescale our engineers have given us is 10pm tonight .
will you be ok ?
thanks , lottie
has the power been restored in sk22 ?
not at home at the moment so we do n't know .
hi john , could you possibly confirm your address & full postcode via dm so that i can check on this for you ?
- hannah
property in ca10 no electricity since 3am this morning .
currently blocked in by significance snow .

hi andrew , apologies for the delay in responding to you .
if you 'd like to dm your full address & postal code , i can have a look into any available updates for you ?
- hannah

documents.title: sport : weather hits sporting fixtures
text: five national league fixtures on saturday involving north west football clubs have become casualties of the extreme weather .
in rugby league , the st helens v salford city reds game has bee rearranged from tonight to sunday at 16:00 gmt .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: breakingmore than 200 motorists spent the night on motorway
text: more than 200 motorists spent the night on the m62 due to the severe weather , police have revealed .
at one point , 3,500 vehicles were trapped yesterday evening as snow , ice and high winds brought the motorway to a standstill between rochdale and huddersfield .

documents.title: industrial estate device was 'shell casing '
text: a `` device '' found on an industrial estate in st helens turned out just to be the `` casing of a shell '' , merseyside police have said .
it has been declared safe and will soon be removed from the penlake industrial estate .
last month , an unexploded world war two bomb was found on the estate leading to homes and businesses being evacuated .

documents.title: pennine routes still blocked
text: most routes across the pennines - including the m62 - are still blocked by drifting snow and abandoned vehicles , say highways england .
the motorway remains closed `` indefinitely '' between junctions 20 and 24 because of snow , ice and high winds , say greater manchester police .

the highways agency said the a628 woodhead pass ( below ) remains closed in both directions between tintwistle and flouch due to severe weather conditions in the region , as is the a57 ( snake pass ) .
there is better news on the a62 between oldham and huddersfield though - while it has reopened , police are warning drivers not to travel `` unless it is essential '' .

documents.title: 'lucky ' driver escapes salford tree fall unscathed
text: a driver had a `` very lucky '' escape after a tree fell on to his car during high winds in salford .
greater manchester police said the driver was uninjured and pulled to safety from his vectra .
littleton road , near manchester united 's old cliff training ground , has been closed temporarily .

documents.title: storm emma wreaks havoc at bbc radio lancashire
text: storm emma has claimed its latest victim - a bbc sign .
high winds have whipped the 'c ' off the bbc radio lancashire display in blackburn town centre .
hardy reporter graham liver braved the storms to rescue it .

documents.title: breakingfire at new strand shopping centre in bootle
text: firefighters have been called to an incident at the new strand shopping centre in bootle , 2 engines in attendance , the shopping centre has been evacuated and crews are seeking the source of smoke .
more updates to follow .

documents.title: man 'trying to cash in ' on m62 snow crisis by selling cups of tea for £ 1
text: motorists stranded on the m62 have been warned to be on the lookout for a man `` trying to cash-in '' on the crisis by selling cups of tea for £ 1 .

documents.title: weather : very windy but less snow
text: there are strong winds across the region this morning with a yellow warning in place as gusts reach 60-70mph .
a few snow flurries this afternoon with temperatures struggling to get above freezing .
more from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: pregnant woman stuck on coach for nine hours in 90mph winds
text: a pregnant woman was stranded in a coach for nine hours on the m62 near rochdale in winds of up to 90mph .
she was one of 60 people stuck on a coach trying to get to leeds .
meanwhile one woman in milnrow put up five people in her home and others were sent to a rescue centre .

documents.title: m62 section to stay 'closed into the weekend '
text: a stretch of the m62 will stay closed into the weekend because of snow and ice , the bbc understands .
greater manchester police has announced the motorway will be closed `` indefinitely '' between junction 20 at rochdale and junction 24 , huddersfield .
posting on twitter , matt stewart said : `` i was at junction 21 - no-one knows anything on there .
`` it 's an absolute shambles .
i went to the top of a hill and it looks clear of snow as far as i can see . ''
police have also warned motorists to `` adhere to all road closure signs '' as people have driven past them and then got stuck in snow .

documents.title: lasagne and sausage rolls for 1,000 drivers stuck for 18 hours
text: rochdale residents and a local supermarket have sent food for drivers stuck for nearly 18 hours in the snowbound m62 in milnrow .
lasagne , hot soup and sausage rolls have been provided for up to 1,000 motorists stranded since 16:30 gmt on thursday .
milnrow resident gary foster said one 15-year-old used a ladder to climb up onto the motorway to help stranded drivers and their passengers .
this lad walked up to two miles to bring blankets and hot food and water .
he was amazing and has come again to help .
some people have even made lasagne to bring to stranded motorists .
we 've also had hot sausage rolls for up to 1,000 people stuck .

documents.title: breakingm62 to stay shut 'indefinitely ' , say police
text: the m62 remains closed indefinitely from junction 20 ( rochdale ) to junction 24 ( huddersfield ) , police have announced .
more to follow

documents.title: rochdale school opens doors to help snowbound drivers
text: newhey community primary school in rochdale has opened its doors to help motorists caught in the m62 snow chaos .
the school , which is just off junction 21 , is closed to pupils but opened up at 05:00 with staff directing drivers to the school for tea , coffee and breakfast .
headteacher clair gooding said they 've helped more than 40 people so far :
we 're still able to take a lot more .
i know people are concerned about leaving their vehicles , so we 're actually taking flasks of tea and coffee up to them as well .
but if they want some food and need the toilet , do feel free to come down because i do n't think the traffic is moving any time soon .

documents.title: blackpool pub death : two charged with simon marx murder
text: two men have been charged with murdering a man died who died on holiday the day after a fight at a pub in his home town .
simon marx , 42 , collapsed and died in fethiye , turkey , on 8 october .
post-mortem tests found he had suffered blunt head trauma .
steven lane , 29 , and david easter , 54 , have been charged with murder and will appear at blackpool magistrates ' court later .

documents.title: second device found on st helens industrial estate
text: police say they 're investigating after a device was found on an industrial estate in st helens - just ten days after an unexploded bomb was discovered there .
a cordon has been set up around penlake industrial estate between lionel street and penlake lane and the fire brigade is also on the scene .
last month , an unexploded world war two bomb was found on the estate leading to homes and businesses being evacuated .

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: man jailed over bullets hidden in his bottom
text: a man has been jailed after police caught him with two bullets wedged in a package between his buttocks .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: another 'snow day ' for thousands of lancashire schoolkids
text: dozens of schools remain closed across lancashire - here 's a full list from the county council ( we 'll bring you news shortly from blackburn with darwen ; and blackpool )

documents.title: community hall opens for people trapped in m62 snow
text: a community centre near rochdale , has become an emergency shelter helping hundreds of motorists trapped in the snow on the m62 motorway .
local residents opened up butterworth hall in milnrow overnight to make tea and toast for people stranded when the m62 motorway closed .
rochdale councillor irene davidson was one of those who turned out to help .
she told bbc breakfast that volunteers climbed up the motorway embankment to offer people in their cars food , shelter and a bed for the night .
i 'd say we 've fed well over 250 people now and we 've got more coming in .
they are so grateful .
people have been sending me messages from all over the country - it 's been absolutely wonderful !

documents.title: merseyrail running reduced service
text: adverse weather timetable changes due to the current adverse weather , a reduced service will be in operation across the merseyrail network on friday 2nd march .
please check : for full timetables .
hi , really sorry to bother but , i ca n't seem to access the full time table - the link is n't loading at all : / just want to see the trains i can get to ormskirk- can you help ?
hi francesca , very sorry for the late reply .
did you manage to find out the times ?
^dm

the people who made that call have made a rather large error ! ! !
hi anthony , the reduced timetable is due to a lot of our trains becoming frozen in places that we are unable to defrost at the moment .
very sorry for the disruption this is causing .
^dm

hi shaun , the 0915 is yes .
thank you .

high winds & very cold , but hardly adverse weather conditions !
not sure how trains are frozen today , but seemed to cope ok earlier in the week , when it was in the minus figures
hi lou , this was due to a number of our trains freezing in the sub-zero temperatures meaning we have less trains available for service today .
sorry for the disruption this is causing .
^dm

hi jack , sorry for the delay in getting back to you .
have you completed your journey now ?
^dm
it would help if the web page would load to check the timetable .
we are aware of this luke , sorry for this can we help with times ?
^dm
can you make this kind of information a tad more accessible on your app please ?
thank you .
i will pass your comments on to our marketing team mark .
thanks ^dm
why ?
this is due to the adverse weather conditions which is causing several of our trains to become frozen unfortunately .
please accept our apologies for any inconvenience this may cause .

documents.title: baby trapped in m62 snow chaos given warm milk by volunteers
text: volunteers who went to the aid of people trapped in their cars on the m62 near greater manchester took warm milk for a five-week-old baby .
volunteer eleanor kelly , 19 , said about 30 people from milnrow trekked through the snow to take supplies to the trapped motorists - including to a father with a baby and toddler in the car .
it 's been a bit mad .
we even had to warm up some hot milk for a guy stuck at the junction with two children .
we knocked on his car and he had a five-week-old baby and what must have been a one or two-year-old girl in the car with him .

documents.title: army sent in to rescue stranded m62 motorists
text: the army has been sent in to rescue hundreds of motorists stuck in the snow on the m62 near greater manchester , said police .
the soldiers were deployed to back up emergency services to help people stranded between rochdale and huddersfield .
greater manchester police said the armed forces will help clear the roads and get people to safety .
police are filtering traffic off the m62 at junction 20 , the exit for rochdale , oldham a627 ( m ) .

documents.title: snow and high winds leave thousands without power
text: electrictiy workers are struggling to reconnect supplies after snow and high winds brought down power lines across the region .
electricity north west said thousands of homes have been cut off in stockport , oldham , preston , blackburn , bolton , manchester , carlisle and parts of cumbria and derbyshire .
the firm said some of their work teams have had to stop repairs due to high winds and heavy snow .
# stormemma is still impacting our region , please see below the postcodes affected by known faults .
our engineers are on site in the area but due to the weather conditions repairs are being delayed - updates to follow - rach

documents.title: residents come to the aid of drivers stuck on m62
text: dozens of volunteers battled through the snow to help drivers trapped in their cars on the m62 motorway in greater manchester .
the motorway was closed in both directions overnight between junctions 21 and 24 due to high winds and heavy snow leaving hundreds of motorists stranded .
residents in milnrow , rochdale , went their aid , bringing hot drinks , food and blankets .
highways england say work is continuing to clear snow and move abandoned vehicles .
kate set off for leeds with her husband and two children at 11:00 on thursday but had to turn back from littleborough because of `` treacherous '' driving conditions .
the a62 has been horrendous we 've been stuck there for eight hours .
i was a bit worried when we were stuck on the moors .
it 's been the snowdrifts , the road disappears and then before you know it you can be waist deep . ''

documents.title: school closures across lancashire
text: a number of schools in lancashire are closed today due to the adverse weather .
a full list of closures can be found on the bbc radio lancashire facebook page and here .

documents.title: weather : yellow and amber warnings in place
text: rather a lot of cloud through this morning , bringing the risk of snow flurries .
further snow at times this afternoon with limited amounts of brightness .
very cold in a brisk easterly wind that could see gusts of 60-70mph .

documents.title: hundreds of drivers stranded overnight as m62 closed
text: hundreds of drivers have spent the night stranded in their cars in greater manchester due to snow , ice and strong winds .
some have been stuck for over 12 hours and the m62 is currently closed in both directions between junction 24 and 21 due to heavy snow and high winds .
dozens of volunteers have been battling through the snow to take supplies to people and rest centres have been set up at oldham fire station and butterworth hall at milnrow .
emergency services and mountain rescue teams say they 're doing all they can to reach stranded drivers in terrible conditions .
greater manchester police are advising against all non-essential travel .

documents.title: 'do n't drive unless essential ' - greater manchester police
text: snow , strong winds and sub zero temperatures are continuing to cause chaos across large parts of greater manchester this morning , with a number of drivers stranded in their cars on trans-pennine routes in oldham , tameside and rochdale .
the m62 is closed in both directions - between milnrow and huddersfield .
the woodhead pass is shut - and the a58 halifax road in littleborough is closed .
locally , roads are already gridlocked in oldham and rochdale .
other routes which are closed include the a62 at delph in saddleworth , where some drivers have been stuck overnight .
police are warning people not to drive this morning unless it 's absolutely essential .
further update for drivers
hi , we ca n't advise schools to shut , this is a decision they 'll have to make .

# staysafe # keepwarmkeepwell .
you guys are awesome !

documents.title: cars abandoned on cheshire route as snow forces closures

they include the a537 cat and fiddle road between macclesfield and buxton and the a53 between leek and buxton .
cheshire police says several vehicles were abandoned on the cat and fiddle overnight and a man in a van was saved after getting stuck .

documents.title: teens seriously hurt by falling tree
text: two teenagers were seriously injured when they were trapped beneath a falling conifer in manchester .
greater manchester fire and rescue service used a chainsaw to cut the two men free on erskine road in blackley at about 14:00 .
a spokesman said the pair suffered serious but not life-threatening injuries .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day

in the meantime , this page will be updated automatically with content from across the bbc .

documents.title: no eta for reopening m62 after heavy snow and fire
text: highways england has said there is `` no eta for re-opening '' the m62 after heavy snow and a vehicle fire .
one of the agency 's cars caught fire this morning while trying to tow a vehicle that was stuck near junction 21 this morning .
a spokesman said : `` once all the vehicles have been recovered , the carriageway will need to be cleared of snow and then gritted '' .
north west motorway police tweeted to ask those stuck in queues to remain calm .

documents.title: memorial to wallasey ww2 spitfire pilot hero unveiled
text: a memorial for a world war two spitfire pilot believed to have inspired scenes in the film dunkirk has been unveiled in wallasey .

documents.title: latest headlines from the north west
text: latest headlines from the north west

documents.title: snow-hit oldham gp practices 'unable to deliver full service '
text: patients are being asked to check if they should still attend appointments at a number of gp practices in oldham hit by extreme weather .
nhs oldham ccg said the wintry conditions and road closures meant they faced staffing problems and were `` unable to deliver a full service '' .
chief clinical officer dr john patterson said : our priority is to try and ensure all patients ' needs are met . ''
a list of surgeries affected can be found here .

documents.title: alfie evans appeal : state 'interfering with parental choices '
text: lawyers representing the parents of seriously ill toddler alfie evans said the state is interfering with parental choices in a `` fundamental way '' .
judges are hearing an appeal against a high court ruling which granted doctors from alder hey children 's hospital permission to withdraw life support from the 21-month-old .
stephen knafler , representing alfie 's parents , has been presenting the family 's arguments to the three court of appeal judges in london .
he said : `` the parents are n't requesting alder hey to provide a different form of treatment .
what they want is simply to take alfie away to another hospital . ''

mr knafler told the court alfie 's parents , tom evans and kate james from bootle , could arrange for their son 's transportation to rome where they want him to be treated in the `` very near future '' .
you can read a full report from the hearing here

documents.title: three held over turkey death after blackpool pub fight
text: three men have been arrested on sus of murdering a man who died on holiday the day after a fight at a pub in his home town .
simon marx , 42 , died in fethiye , turkey on 8 october .
police say he had been involved in an altercation at the newton arms in staining at about 12.20 the night before , and a post-mortem established that he died from a blunt head trauma .
witnesses are sought and police particularly want to identify a man who may have spoken to mr marx in winstons bar on highfield road at about 01:00 on 7 october .

documents.title: use up your tenners !
text: a quick reminder that today is the last day that paper £ 10 notes featuring charles darwin are being accepted in shops .
the bank of england has been gradually replacing them with new polymer jane austen notes since september .
from friday , anyone with a charles darwin tenner will need to deposit it at their bank as shops will be entitled to refuse it .
a collection of new 10p coins featuring 26 designs celebrating britain , from cricket to queuing , are also entering circulation today .

documents.title: hospitals trust makes 'real improvement '
text: hospitals trust makes 'real improvement '

documents.title: football : liverpool defender says he had to 'step up ' his game at anfield
text: virgil van dijk says he had to `` step up '' his game when he joined liverpool for £ 75m in january .
the former celtic and southampton centre-back , 26 , scored on his debut at anfield against everton in the fa cup .
however , van dijk says he has needed time to adapt to jurgen klopp 's high-tempo , pressing style of play .
`` i am getting used to how we play , '' he told football focus .
`` the intensity of our game is a lot higher than what i was used to . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 'do n't call 999 unless it 's an absolute emergency '
text: north west ambulance service is advising people to only call 999 if it 's an absolute emergency .
please bear with us as we 'll be driving a little bit slower than usual to help us get through the snow so it may take us a little bit longer to get to you .
please help us out by only calling 999 in a life-threatening emergency # maketherightcall
was wondering , do ambulances have 4 wheel drive that would help with snow and mud etc ?
not as standard- some of the rrvs have 4 wheel drive as do some specialist vehicles .
we do have winter tyres 's on though - which help !
i bet , anything for a bit of traction !
# safetyfirst - winter tyres also aid with breaking in the wet , helping to reduce stopping distances .
stay safe everyone .
very grateful for your endeavours in tricky times , guys .
dedicated as always to serving communities .

documents.title: united utilities experiencing 'high number of calls ' due to frozen pipes
text: united utilities are advising people what to do about frozen pipes , following a high number of calls about the problem .
severe weather is affecting the whole region , with travel disruption on roads and trains , as well as hundreds of school closures .
our call centre is currently experiencing a high number of calls due to frozen water pipes .
we 're sorry if it 's taking you longer than normal to get through to us .
rather than waiting , please see our website which has all the advice you 'll need .

documents.title: m66 to re-open shortly
text: police say the m66 will be open shortly after a multi-car pile-up .
twenty people were hurt in the crash which closed the motorway near bury , north west ambulance service ( nwas ) said .
elsewhere , a highways england car caught fire while helping stranded vehicles on the m62 eastbound , shutting it at junctions 21 ( milnrow ) and 22 ( saddleworth ) .
m66 sbj1 to j2 is about to be opened .
did the m66 re-open or has been closed since 11:30am ?
when did it re-open ?
the drivers of the first vehicles involved did n't leave lights on including hazard warning lights and did n't use the orange emergency phone .
matrix was not set

documents.title: travel update : m62 queues reducing - but slowly
text: although the m62 has been reopened , things do n't seem to be improving that much after an earlier car fire .
at one stage , there were 16 miles of queues westbound , but that 's now going down .
but there are still about 12 miles of standing traffic , with reports that lorries are struggling to climb hills in the slippery conditions .
some motorists say they 've been stuck for around five-and-a-half hours .
# m62 east bound j20 been sat here since 8am @ twitterid
was the snow , then a traffic officer land rover caught fire .
now i 've heard they are turning the traffic around at j22
stuck in same traffic .
any idea what 's going on ?
ca n't be snow as the other side is flowing ?

documents.title: twenty injured in m66 pile-up
text: twenty people have been injured in a pile-up on the m66 , with two being taken to hospital , north west ambulance service said .
the greater manchester fire and rescue service report that no-one is trapped in their cars .
however paramedics are treating two people in their cars following the 16-vehicle crash between bury and ramsbottom .

documents.title: alfie evans : appeal court judges reject adjournment request
text: judges have refused to give the parents of brain-damaged bootle toddler alfie evans more time to think before deciding on their next move in their battle to prolong his life-support treatment .
a high court judge has previously ruled that doctors at alder hey hospital can stop treating the 21-month-old - against kate james and tom evans ' wishes .
mr justice hayden , who analysed the case at hearings in the family division of the high court in london and liverpool , said he accepted medical evidence suggesting further treatment was futile .
alfie 's parents have challenged this ruling and asked the court of appeal to reconsider the evidence .
three appeal judges have now begun analysing the case at a hearing in london .

their barrister stephen knafler qc told the appeal that he wanted to raise `` various points of law '' and asked for an adjournment of about two weeks so that alfie 's parents could consider various issues .
but the judges refused to adjourn the case , which continues .
